name: web
description:
The Nx Plugin for Web Components contains generators for managing Web Component applications and libraries within an Nx workspace. It provides:


- Integration with libraries such as Jest, Cypress, and Storybook.

- Scaffolding for creating buildable libraries that can be published to npm.

- Utilities for automatic workspace refactoring.

documentation.name: Overview
documentation.content:
The Nx Plugin for Web Components contains generators for managing Web Component applications and libraries within an Nx workspace. It provides:

- Integration with libraries such as Jest, Cypress, and Storybook.
- Scaffolding for creating buildable libraries that can be published to npm.
- Utilities for automatic workspace refactoring.

## Setting Up Web

To create a new workspace with web, run `npx create-nx-workspace@latest --preset=web`.

To add the web plugin to an existing workspace, run one of the following:

```bash
# For npm users
npm install -D @nrwl/web

# For yarn users
yarn add -D @nrwl/web
```

### Creating Applications

You can add a new application with the following:

```bash
nx g @nrwl/web:app my-new-app
```

The application uses no framework and generates with web components. You can add any framework you want on top of the default setup.

To start the application in development mode, run `nx serve my-new-app`.

**Note:** If you are looking to add a React application, check out the [React plugin](/react/overview).

### Creating Libraries

To create a generic TypeScript library (i.e. non-framework specific), use the [`@nrwl/js`](/js/overview) plugin.

```bash
nx g @nrwl/js:lib my-new-lib

# If you want the library to be buildable or publishable to npm
nx g @nrwl/web:lib my-new-lib --buildable
nx g @nrwl/web:lib my-new-lib \
--publishable \
--importPath=@myorg/my-new-lib
```

## Using Web

### Testing Projects

You can run unit tests with:

```bash
nx test my-new-app
nx test my-new-lib
```

Replace `my-new-app` with the name or your project. This command works for both applications and libraries.

You can also run E2E tests for applications:

```bash
nx e2e my-new-app-e2e
```

Replace `my-new-app-e2e` with the name or your project with `-e2e` appended.

### Building Projects

React applications can be build with:

```bash
nx build my-new-app
```

And if you generated a library with `--buildable`, then you can build a library as well:

```bash
nx build my-new-lib
```

The output is in the `dist` folder. You can customize the output folder by setting `outputPath` in the project's `project.json` file.

The application in `dist` is deployable, and you can try it out locally with:

```bash
npx http-server dist/apps/my-new-app
```

The library in `dist` is publishable to npm or a private registry.

## More Documentation

- [Using Cypress](/cypress/overview)
- [Using Jest](/cypress/overview)

unitTestRunner.description: Adds the specified unit test runner

e2eTestRunner.description: Adds the specified e2e test runner

schema.title: Create a Web Application for Nx
schema.description: Create a web application using `swc` or `babel` as compiler.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the application?

directory.description: The directory of the new application.

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests

e2eTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for end to end (e2e) tests

tags.description: Add tags to the application (used for linting)

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside workspace.json

crossOrigin.description: The `crossorigin` attribute to use for generated javascript script tags.  One of 'none' | 'anonymous' | 'use-credentials'.

main.description: The name of the main entry-point file.

tsConfig.description: The name of the Typescript configuration file.

outputPath.description: The output path of the generated files.

deleteOutputPath.description: Delete the output path before building.

baseHref.description: Base url for the application being built.

deployUrl.description: URL where the application will be deployed.

vendorChunk.description: Use a separate bundle containing only vendor libraries.

commonChunk.description: Use a separate bundle containing code used across multiple bundles.

runtimeChunk.description: Use a separate bundle containing the runtime.

sourceMap.description: Output sourcemaps. Use 'hidden' for use with error reporting tools without generating sourcemap comment.

progress.description: Log progress to the console while building.

input.description: The input directory path in which to apply 'glob'. Defaults to the project root.

ignore.description: An array of globs to ignore.

index.description: HTML File which will be contain the application.

scripts.description: External Scripts which will be included before the main application entry.

bundleName.description: The bundle name for this extra entry point.

inject.description: If the bundle will be referenced in the HTML file.

styles.description: External Styles which will be included with the application

bundleName.description: The bundle name for this extra entry point.

inject.description: If the bundle will be referenced in the HTML file.

budgets.description: Budget thresholds to ensure parts of your application stay within boundaries which you set.

maximumWarning.description: The maximum threshold for warning relative to the baseline.

maximumError.description: The maximum threshold for error relative to the baseline.

minimumWarning.description: The minimum threshold for warning relative to the baseline.

minimumError.description: The minimum threshold for error relative to the baseline.

warning.description: The threshold for warning relative to the baseline (min & max).

error.description: The threshold for error relative to the baseline (min & max).

namedChunks.description: Names the produced bundles according to their entry file.

outputHashing.description: Define the output filename cache-busting hashing mode.

stylePreprocessorOptions.description: Options to pass to style preprocessors.

includePaths.description: Paths to include. Paths will be resolved to project root.

optimization.description: Enables optimization of the build output.

scripts.description: Enables optimization of the scripts output.

styles.description: Enables optimization of the styles output.

es2015Polyfills.description: Conditional polyfills loaded in browsers which do not support `ES2015`.

subresourceIntegrity.description: Enables the use of subresource integrity validation.

statsJson.description: Generates a 'stats.json' file which can be analyzed using tools such as: 'webpack-bundle-analyzer' or `<https://webpack.github.io/analyse>`.

extractLicenses.description: Extract all licenses in a separate file, in the case of production builds only.

memoryLimit.description: Memory limit for type checking service process in `MB`.

maxWorkers.description: Number of workers to use for type checking.

fileReplacements.description: Replace files with other files in the build.

buildLibsFromSource.description: Read buildable libraries from source instead of building them separately.

generateIndexHtml.description: Generates `index.html` file to the output path. This can be turned off if using a webpack plugin to generate HTML such as `html-webpack-plugin`.

postcssConfig.description: Set a path to PostCSS config that applies to the app and all libs. Defaults to `undefined`, which auto-detects postcss.config.js files in each `app`/`lib` directory.

webpackConfig.description: Path to a function which takes a webpack config, some context and returns the resulting webpack config. See https://nx.dev/guides/customize-webpack

input.description: The input directory path in which to apply 'glob'. Defaults to the project root.

ignore.description: An array of globs to ignore.

maximumWarning.description: The maximum threshold for warning relative to the baseline.

maximumError.description: The maximum threshold for error relative to the baseline.

minimumWarning.description: The minimum threshold for warning relative to the baseline.

minimumError.description: The minimum threshold for error relative to the baseline.

warning.description: The threshold for warning relative to the baseline (min & max).

error.description: The threshold for error relative to the baseline (min & max).

bundleName.description: The bundle name for this extra entry point.

inject.description: If the bundle will be referenced in the HTML file.

schema.title: Web Library Rollup Target (Experimental)
schema.description: Packages a library for different web usages (`UMD`, `ESM`, `CJS`).

entryFile.description: The path to the entry file, relative to project.

outputPath.description: The output path of the generated files.

deleteOutputPath.description: Delete the output path before building.

format.description: Only build the specified comma-separated formats (`esm,umd,cjs`)

external.description: A list of external modules that will not be bundled (`react`, `react-dom`, etc.).

buildableProjectDepsInPackageJsonType.description: When `updateBuildableProjectDepsInPackageJson` is `true`, this adds dependencies to either `peerDependencies` or `dependencies`.

rollupConfig.description: Path to a function which takes a rollup config and returns an updated rollup config.

umdName.description: The name of your module in `UMD` format. Defaulted to your project name.

globals.description: A mapping of node modules to their `UMD` global names. Used by the `UMD` bundle.

moduleId.description: The node module to map from (e.g. `react-dom`).

global.description: The global name to map to (e.g. `ReactDOM`).

extractCss.description: CSS files will be extracted to the output folder.

input.description: The input directory path in which to apply `glob`. Defaults to the project root.

output.description: Relative path within the output folder.

input.description: The input directory path in which to apply `glob`. Defaults to the project root.

output.description: Relative path within the output folder.

sslKey.description: SSL key to use for serving `HTTPS`.

sslCert.description: SSL certificate to use for serving `HTTPS`.

watch.description: Watches for changes and rebuilds application.

liveReload.description: Whether to reload the page on change, using live-reload.

publicHost.description: Public URL where the application will be served.

open.description: Open the application in the browser.

allowedHosts.description: This option allows you to whitelist services that are allowed to access the dev server.

memoryLimit.description: Memory limit for type checking service process in `MB`.

maxWorkers.description: Number of workers to use for type checking.

baseHref.description: Base url for the application being built.

executors.name: file-server

schema.title: File Server
schema.description: Serve a web application from a folder.

sslKey.description: SSL key to use for serving `HTTPS`.

sslCert.description: SSL certificate to use for serving `HTTPS`.

proxyUrl.description: URL to proxy unhandled requests to.

proxyOptions.description: Options for the proxy used by `http-server`.

executors.description: Serve a web application from a folder.
